summary: This is an email chain from November 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding the tracking and confirmation of delivery of discovery materials (hard drives, discs, passwords) sent via USPS certified mail and FedEx to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for a defendant. It includes tracking numbers and a draft letter about legal mail.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the initial email requesting information about materials sent to MDC last week, as they owe the court a letter by 12 pm the next day.

events.title: Discovery Disc Sent to MDC
events.description: A disc containing 10/25 production of discovery, 10/25 productions of TW and NTW (restamped and new material), and 3500 material was sent via certified mail to MDC.

events.title: Multiple Discovery Shipments to MDC
events.description: A disc containing 10/28 production of discovery and 10/28 production of new GX was sent via certified mail. A hard drive containing all productions described plus the 10/13 discovery production was sent via FedEx to MDC per defense counsel's request.

events.title: Drive and Password Delivery Confirmation
events.description: A drive and a password sent under separate cover were both delivered to the facility at 8:54am. Tracking numbers provided.

events.title: Disc and Password Deliveries Confirmed
events.description: Disc/password sent 10/27 was delivered 11/1 at 6:39am. Disc/password sent 10/29 was delivered 11/2 at 6:57am. Both sent via USPS certified mail.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively sending discovery materials to a defendant at the Metropolitan Detention Center in late October/early November 2021.
Materials included discs and a hard drive containing discovery productions, 3500 material, and productions labeled TW, NTW, and GX.
Shipments were tracked via USPS certified mail and FedEx, with specific tracking numbers documented for each delivery.
A draft letter regarding MDC legal mail was being prepared for submission to the court by 12 pm on November 2, 2021.
The correspondence indicates an organized paralegal system for tracking productions to MDC, with a dedicated folder created for this purpose.
